title: ‘If We Wait, People Will Die’: New Yorkers Still Fend for Themselves in Storms
description: A decade after Hurricane Sandy prompted the city to invest millions in property protection, Hurricane Ida showed how vulnerable homeowners and renters really are to flash flooding.
dc:creator: Ronda Kaysen
media:credit: Clark Hodgin for The New York Times
media:description: Ariadna Phillips and her son Gabriel Egbert in the Bronx. After Superstorm Sandy, Ms. Phillips lost power for days in Bayside, Queens. Nine years later, Hurricane Ida flooded her basement apartment in the Bronx. “I was bouncing from place to place to place and begging for assistance,” she said.
